refnamediv.refpurpose: unset an environment variable mask then chain

refsection.title: NOTE
refsection.para: C-shells have a built-in unsetenv command that does not chain. See the manual for each individual shell for its built-in command.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: unsetenv is a chain-loading utility that unsets the environment variable var and then chain loads to next-prog with the execvp3 function.
next-prog may contain its own command line options, which unsetenv will ignore.
Unsetting a variable is not the same as setting it to an empty value. For that, see setenv1.
If var contains an equals character, counter-intuitive things will happen to the environment.

refsection.title: BUGS
refsection.para: Although not strictly a bug in this program, it is worth noting that the GNU C library and the BSD library both have memory leaks in their unsetenv3 functions, used by this program. You can work around these bugs by ensuring that next-prog is not a built-in command (see exec1).
